title: Failed to produce attestation
body:
I'm getting an exception on 1 of my 2 validators. It's currently missing every attestation. This started after my machine filled the disk, I cleared space, and restarted.

Apr 16 09:06:11 eth2mainnet teku[2811]: 09:06:11.558 ERROR - Validator   *** Failed to produce attestation  Slot: 979529 Validator: 0x916b142397d57e0bd0dcffb4d583e039ae26b615f76d65e2a14ed5b06fd7158a24cb2ac9ada11a6cffb8ec7178f4e3a5

* Software version: [teku/v21.4.0/linux-x86_64/-ubuntu-openjdk64bitservervm-java-11
* Java version: openjdk version "11.0.10" 2021-01-19
* OS Name & Version: Ubuntu 20.04
* Kernel Version: 5.8.0-49-generic

@felso - it looks like one of your slashing protection records got corrupted.  If you check the record for this validator, I suspect that file will be empty. The record should be at `<data-dir>/slashprotection/<validatorpubkey>.yml`

You generally want to be very careful with the slashing protection files.  But in this case (if you do confirm that the yml file is corrupted), since your validator has been offline for several hours, it should be fine to: stop the node, delete the corrupted file (leaving the other files untouched!), and restart.  To be extra safe, you may want to wait for a few epochs before restarting the node.
Thank you @mbaxter. That worked. Both validators are currently working.
We're looking into making this easier to clean up in the future: https://github.com/ConsenSys/teku/issues/3868
